title: Wisdom for Living
shortSummary: Proverbs 20 offers practical wisdom on integrity, diligence, leadership, and the consequences of folly. It emphasizes the value of righteousness, wise counsel, and self-control as foundations for a blessed life under God's sovereign guidance.

keyCharacters.name: The King
keyCharacters.description: A figure representing earthly authority whose fear and judgment are to be respected and whose integrity affects the welfare of the people.

keyCharacters.name: The Sluggard
keyCharacters.description: A lazy person who neglects work and suffers poverty as a result, illustrating the consequences of idleness.

keyCharacters.name: The Fool
keyCharacters.description: One who meddles in strife and lacks wisdom, contrasting with the honorable man who avoids conflict.

keyCharacters.name: The Buyer
keyCharacters.description: A person who undervalues goods deceptively, highlighting dishonesty in commerce.

definitions.definition: Unequal or dishonest scales used in trade, condemned as an abomination to the LORD for promoting injustice.
A lazy or idle person who avoids work, leading to poverty and lack.
A person who guarantees another's debt or obligation, often risking their own property.
One who spreads gossip or reveals secrets, causing division and strife.

outline.heading: Warnings Against Folly and Drunkenness
outline.description: This section warns against the deception of wine and strong drink, the danger of provoking authority, and the value of wise counsel hidden within the heart.

outline.heading: Integrity, Justice, and Honesty
outline.description: Emphasizes the rarity and blessing of faithfulness and integrity, condemns dishonest weights and measures, and highlights the value of truthful knowledge over material wealth.

outline.heading: Practical Wisdom in Relationships and Speech
outline.description: Advises caution in financial dealings and relationships, warns against deceit and cursing parents, and encourages trusting God rather than seeking personal revenge.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereignty and the Role of the King
outline.description: Affirms God's control over human paths, the importance of mercy and truth in leadership, and the king’s role in executing justice and scattering the wicked.

outline.heading: The Value of Strength, Discipline, and Correction
outline.description: Contrasts the vigor of youth with the wisdom of age and teaches that physical discipline can cleanse and correct inner faults.

application: Avoid the deception of alcohol and practice self-control to maintain wisdom and honor before God.
Pursue integrity and faithfulness in all areas of life, knowing that God blesses those who walk uprightly.
Seek and value wise counsel in decision-making, especially in difficult or strategic matters.
Trust God to bring justice rather than taking personal revenge, demonstrating patience and faith in His sovereignty.

keyVerses.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
keyVerses.significance: This verse warns against the dangers of alcohol and highlights the importance of wisdom and self-control.

keyVerses.text: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores the blessing that flows from a life of integrity, extending to future generations.

keyVerses.text: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches believers to trust God's justice rather than seeking personal revenge.

keyVerses.text: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals that God’s Spirit illuminates the human heart, exposing inner thoughts and motives.
